intro: Cylicodiscus battiscombei, commonly known as the Natal daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers surrounded by pale green bracts, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils. It typically grows as a low shrub with woody stems and narrow, linear leaves. Cylicodiscus battiscombei is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive blooms and drought tolerance.
